title: FPS2

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FPS2
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

According to the the CMS Website, in 2011, the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (“CMS”) developed and implemented the Fraud Prevention System (“FPS”), now FPS2, to implement predictive analytics technologies to identify and prevent the payment of fraudulent claims in the Medicare Fee-for-Service Program. The FPS 2 develops models to identify fraud waste and abuse and monitor the models to validate effective alerting.

I am seeking:

1) Contracts, memorandums of understanding, and statements of work between the department and any outside party regarding the implementation and development of FPS2 of any service to detect or predict fraud

2) Documentation of FPS 2 or predictive models that the agency currently uses (including those used as aids to human decision making). This documentation should include, where available: executive summaries of the algorithm/model's purpose, lists of the data sources, breakdowns of how the model weights various input data, descriptions of the statistical or machine learning techniques employed, the results of validation and accuracy testing, disparate impact studies, and algorithmic impact reports.

3) A data dictionary/library for each predictive or detection model or algorithm identified in response to items 1 and 2 of this requests.

4) Copies of any internal or independent audits of the identified models or algorithms.

5) Aggregate or disaggregated data, if any exists, breaking down the risk scores or outputs of the fraud model.

6) Training data code and model files for the above algorithms.

As required under FOIA, I request that the agency provide the above records in their native digital format, where applicable (such as a CSV, Excel, or other digital data format), and transferred to me electronically.

News media status and fee waiver:

As a reporter for WIRED, I qualify as a news media requester for the purpose of fees. See 5 U.S.C. 552(a)(4)(A)(ii). Further, because this request is being made for a journalistic purpose regarding a matter of public interest, I further ask that you waive any fees. See 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(A)(iii). Disclosure of information regarding the use of predictive analytics will contribute significantly to public understanding of how CMS uses advanced machine learning technology. This request is not primarily in the commercial interest of myself or WIRED.

Additionally, please notify me of costs before taking any billable steps.

Segregability:

If you deny this request in whole or in part, I request that you respond with the statutory
exemption underlying the denial and the reasoning therein. If an asserted exemption applies to
only a portion of a record, please delete or redact the portion to which the exemption applies and
provide the remainder of the record, as required under the FOIA.

If you have any questions about my request, please do not hesitate to e-mail me or call
me. Conde Nast's legal counsel is also copied on this letter. We look forward to a response as quickly as possible under the provisions of the Freedom of Information
Act (5 U.S.C. Section 552).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dhruv Mehrotra

title: Communications Regarding Vote Changes in the New York State Senate

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Communications Regarding Vote Changes in the New York State Senate
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Given recent reports in the Buffalo News regarding instances of retroactively altered votes in the New York State Senate, I am seeking access to the following records:

1. Any and all written communications, including but not limited to emails, memos, and text messages, among Senate members, their staff, and any other relevant parties, regarding the alteration of votes on the bill allowing Gov. Kathy Hochul to enter a new gaming compact with the Seneca Nation and the bill rolling back a major campaign finance reform law. This should cover the period from June 1, 2023, to the present.

2. Any and all instructions or guidelines provided to Senate members or their staff regarding the process or possibility of altering votes after they have been cast. This should cover the period from January 1, 2023, to the present.

3. Any and all records of requests made by Senate members to alter their votes after they have been cast, including the reasons provided for such requests. This should cover the period from January 1, 2023, to the present.

I understand that there may be fees associated with the processing of this request. Please inform me of any such fees before processing the request.

If any part of this request is denied, please cite the specific exemption you believe justifies your refusal to release the information and inform me of your agency's appeal procedures.

Thank you for your attention to this matter.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker

title: Springfield Public Schools New Police MOU

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Springfield Public Schools New Police MOU
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

The recently signed memorandum of understanding between Springfield Public Schools and Springfield's Police Department that was covered in this article: https://www.wamc.org/news/2023-06-28/springfield-school-committee-approves-new-agreement-on-having-police-officers-in-schools. 

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FOIA Devereaux Knox Vietnam War  ST-2
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

OMPF for Devereaux Knox including cumulative record of training, history of assignments, military education, transfers and receipts, all military decorations and citations, personnel evaluations, unit awards, deployments South Vietnam.
1) History of Assignments NAVPERS form 601-5
2) Navy Occupational training history NAVPERS 601-4
3) Cumulative transfers and receipts NAVPERS 601-12, administrative remarks
4) Bronze Star Medal award citations, Navy Commendation Medal citations
Retired Master Chief MMCM, retired 1988. Awards include Bronze Star Medal with Combat V, Navy Commendation Medal, Combat Action Ribbon, good conduct medal, Presidential Unit Citation, Navy Unit Commendation, Vietnam Service Medal. Service with ST-2 SEAL TEAM TWO  Vietnam Conflict 1967 to 1969, UDT-21. Training includes Underwater Demolition Team Replacement UDTR training, Basic Airborne School, SERE, 5321 UDT Swimmer, 5326 Navy SEAL.
Passed away Thursday, May 20, 2010.

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Any Florida Attorney General Documents that would Identify Any State Of Florida Agencies Required By Law To Investigate Organized Crime in Florida.
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any Florida Attorney General (hereafter FLAG) documents that would identify any State of Florida entities required by law to investigate the alleged operation of organized crime syndicates or white collar organized crime syndicates operating in Florida, targeting Florida residents.
2. Any FLAG documents used to define (definition for) the phrase "organized crime" in the State of Florida.
3. Any FLAG documents used to define (definition for) the phrase " white color organized crime" in the State of Florida.
4. A copy of any FL AG policy/protocol for representing non-Florida politicians in federal court, who have alleged ties to organized crime.
5. A copy of any FLAG policy/protocol for representing non-Florida politicians in federal court, who are involved in alleged "Fraud on the Court" schemes.
  (Definition for Fraud on the Court)The requisite fraud on the court occurs where “it can be demonstrated, clearly and convincingly, that a party has sentiently set in motion some unconscionable scheme calculated to interfere with the judicial system’s ability impartially to adjudicate a matter by improperly influencing the trier of fact or unfairly hampering the presentation of the opposing party’s claim or defense.” Aoude v. Mobil Oil Corp., 892 F.2d 1115, 1118 (1st Cir. 1989). . . .:
6. Any FLAG documents that would exempt Lawyers employed by FLAG office from compliance with Florida Bar, Rules of Professional Conduct https://www-media.floridabar.org/uploads/2023/06/Ch-4.pdf
6. Any documents of the vetting of Robert Butterworth, for FLAG.
7. Any documents of the FLAG for the vetting of Scott Masel for head of Florida Attorney General office CIVIL Division, Ft. Lauderdale.
8. Any documents of the FLAG for the vetting of the female (Scott Masel's counterpart) for head of Florida Attorney General office CRIMINAL Division, Ft. Lauderdale.
9. Any FLAG documents on a Richard McCleary drug trafficking operation out of Florida, Vero Beach or Key West,Florida to Maryland, Ocean City or Salisbury)
10. Any FLAG investigation into Florida Dept. of Law Enforcement employees, Michael Ramage, David Sessions, Tim Elder, or Michael Washam.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Don Stone

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Tos Violation
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Expedited handling requested

I was seeking a copy of the annual code of conduct affirmation that is signed by each EOUSA or USAO employee to comply with the standards of conduct outlaid by the Department of Justice including but not limited to: 1-4.200 - Allegations of Misconduct by Department of Justice Employees—General Considerations etc.

Justification for expedited handling:  By EOUSA FOIA volition a pattern of requests has been overturned by the DOJ OIP, this casts a reasonable doubt in relation to morale with the EOUSA and its ethics in handling FOIA/PA on behalf of the United States and its management of the FOIA/PA or lack thereof.  I wish to urgently educate the public about the operations of EOUSA and ensure that any young person who would endeavor to pursue a career in civil service be aware of the guidelines for performance that it includes.  

Fee Waiver:
Not requested.  This document should be a common document in every EOUSA personnel file. I do not think the search should exceed the free time allowed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Leadership Personnel Files
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Please supply the full personnel files of the following individuals:

*Bogdana Chkoumbova, current Chief Education Officer
*Stephanie Jones, previous Chief of ODLSS
*Jorge Macias, current Chief of Language and Cultural Education
*Adrian Segura, current Chief of FACE

This includes any resumes, applications, any job recommendations, promotions, professional license credentials and verification records. Please include a work/salary history. Please include any investigative materials - investigative memorandums, disciplinary actions (suspensions, leaves of absence that stem from disciplinary action), incident reports, EOCO investigations, Office of Civil Rights determinations, non-disciplinary memorandum of understandings, non-union misconduct form, full warning resolutions and any complaints or claims/lawsuits/settlements. Please include any safety plans. Please include any separation agreements and any other disclosure agreements.

Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

Chicago Public Schools (CPS) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. 
If further time is needed to assemble and copy all documents responsive to your FOIA request, we will contact you with a time estimate and a request to extend. 
Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. Copies of video recordings have a fee of $48. All applicable fees must be paid prior to the copying. CPS will inform you of any fees due if your paper response exceeds 50 pages. title: Carl S. Bat

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Carl S. Bat
communications.communication:
Dear National Park Service:

This is a request for records under the Freedom of Information Act.

RECORDS REQUESTED:

I am seeking records related to NPS mascot Carl S. Bat, mascot for Carlsbad Caverns National Park.

Specifically, I request the following records:

1. Please produce all records related to the conception, creation, and design/re-design of the Carl S. Bat mascot. Please include any contracts or design concepts (e.g. sketches) in your production, as well as any records related to NPS's decision to create a mascot for Carlsbad Caverns in the first place.

2. Please produce all Carl S. Bat-related promotional items, educational items, or tchotchkes, past or present, that took the form of records, such as trading cards, posters, videos, worksheets, or books (including but not limited to coloring books, activity books, or comic books).

3. Please produce all records related to the conception, creation, design, and use of any wearable Carl S. Bat costumes. (The attached screenshots from NPS's social media suggest that Carl's costume got an update sometime between 2014 and 2022, so please produce records for the different versions.) Responsive records would include contracts for the design or production of such a costume; design proposals or sketches; correspondence with the designer or manufacturer; and any guidelines related to the use of or care for the costume.

4. Please produce all communications related to Carl S. Bat.

5. Please produce all correspondence related to Carl S. Bat (or to mascots in general) sent to or from any member of Congress, their office, or their staff. Senator Tom Coburn (R-OK) may have sent some responsive correspondence around 2007, and Senator Joni Ernst (R-IA) may have sent some around 2019. 

6. Please produce all records related to any proposal or decision to stop using Carl S. Bat as part of NPS's public outreach.

REQUEST FOR FEE WAIVER:

The requested documents will be made available to the general public online for free, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. I am working on a project examining the history, creation, evolution, and use of mascots across the federal government—because, like many others, I find them fascinating and weirdly delightful. Thus, I respectfully request that any fees related to this request be waived. If you do decide to charge me fees, please notify me in advance if you expect those fees to exceed $25.

FORM OF PRODUCTION:

I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or on CD-ROM if not.

CONCLUSION:

Thank you very much for your cooperation with this request. I look forward to hearing from you soon!

Sincerely,

Nicholas Marritz

title: Records Retention Schedules, Org Charts, Employee Chart, Master List of Forms, FOAA Log

communications.subject: Maine Freedom of Access Act Request: Records Retention Schedules, Org Charts, Employee Chart, Master List of Forms, FOAA Log
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maine Freedom of Access Act, I hereby request the following records:

For all organizations within the Maine Department of Public Safety:
Records Retention Schedules
Employee Name / Title / Salary List
Organizational Chart
Master List of Forms
FOAA Log (If kept)

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by 1 M.R.S.A. § 408(6). The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Corey Bouchard
